items.title: Provide data table toolbar heights to match new row heights

labels.name: severity: 3
labels.description: Affects minor functionality, has a workaround

items.body: ### Summary The Cloud & Cognitive data table workstream is requesting additional data table toolbar heights in order to match the available row heights. Currently there are 4 possible row heights for data tables (with a 5th height coming in Carbon 11): - Compact 24px - Short 32px - Default 48px - Tall 64px However there are only two toolbar heights, 32px and 48px. The majority of row heights will have to be paired with a clashing toolbar. We are asking for development support to add additional toolbar heights, so that the toolbar height always matches the row height. **As-Is: 24px row height with 32px toolbar and 48px pagination bar** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/121441734-fa11c500-c94f-11eb-961b-bce2ef716633.png) **Proposed: All components are 24px** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/121441759-01d16980-c950-11eb-8956-359d588842c6.png) **Note:** this issue is not as high a priority as [Provide pagination bar heights to match new data table row heights #8874](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/issues/8874). For MVP we could just add a 32px pagination height. The compact toolbar size (24px) is tricky as Carbon does not currently offer 24px search or buttons. **MVP option: 24px row height with 32px toolbar and 48px pagination bar** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/121441853-29283680-c950-11eb-84e6-5ad978d4fa8d.png) ### Justification - We are rolling out the table settings feature more widely, which means that these alternative heights will begin to be more heavily used, and the visual inconsistencies will become more obvious. - Today, if a user switches to the 24px row height, their pagination will still be 48px, and their toolbar will be 32px. It would be nice to have consistency across these elements. ### Desired UX and success metrics If a user switches row height, the table toolbar would switch to matching height. ### "Must have" functionality N/A ### Specific timeline issues / requests Ideally it would be great to roll this out with Carbon 11 as we introduce the new row heights. We would love to roll this update into the data table settings feature being worked on by the Cloud & Cognitive data table workstream. ### Available extra resources We can provide design support and potentially some dev support.

items.body:
Just passing along some feedback received regarding the "Cancel" button for the action bar. 

**Feedback:**
Received a comment that it was not immediately understandable as to what that button would do if clicked, as they would just expect it to be labeled "unselect all." Was confused as to why that would be an option while also pressing the 'select/unselect all' checkbox on the table would perform the same action.

Curious if anyone has ever had this same comment or confusion as to what "cancel" would do.

**Suggestion:**
Could add a tooltip giving a simple explanation that cancel will unselect all selections and reset the table to the previous state.

items.title: Enable set data table truncation and text wrap behavior
items.body: ### Summary Currently the data table does not start horizontal scrolling until text wraps to three lines. - Hard for user to mentally and visually process - No ability for designer and dev to choose settings that make sense for use case - Table has to become uncomfortable before horizontal scrolling kicks in - When text truncates today there is no way for user to see full text CDAI data table team is proposing this change per our discussion with Carbon design in February. As-Is To-Be where table set to use truncation ### Justification See above ### Desired UX and success metrics 1.) A developer can set line wrap/truncation preferences before horizontal scrolling kicks in 2.) A user can focus on table content without getting distracted by crowded 3-line cells 3.) When text is truncated user can view full text via browser tooltip on hover ### "Must have" functionality - Establish a default setting (ex: 2 line wrap where once 2 lines does not fit, horizontal scroll kicks in) - Ability for developer to edit those settings - When text is truncated user can view full text via browser tooltip on hover Developer should have the following options: - 2-line text wrap: Option to wrap to 2 lines (instead of 3) - Truncate: Optical truncation at 1 line, tooltip on hover with full text - would be really nice to be able to choose middle or end truncation! ### Specific timeline issues / requests As soon as possible but preferably during Q2 as CDAI data table responsive behavior depends on this ### Available extra resources CDAI devs could potentially help code

items.title: [üó£Ô∏èDISCUSSIONüó£Ô∏è]Should our data table become a data grid?
items.body:
ref #4981 

At the highest level tables vs. grids can be (clumsily) summed up as:
- a **table**'s default semantics should be used for simply displaying non-interactive tabular data (this does not imply or include per-cell keyboard navigation)
- adding the **grid** role (and other complimentary aria) would imply to user's with a screen reader that they're up against some kind of widget with Excel-like features (sorting, menus, selection etc) organized logically in a grid

Our Datatable as it stands can satisfy one or the other of those criteria.

If the goal is improved usability (or meeting interaction expectations) for keyboard/screen reader user's should our Datatable become a data grid under the hood? 

Some starting point references for deeper dives into the differences:
https://adrianroselli.com/2017/11/hey-its-still-ok-to-use-tables.html
https://adrianroselli.com/2020/07/aria-grid-as-an-anti-pattern.html

items.title: Filter panel and display bar for data table
items.body: ### Summary We are requesting a filter panel which will enable users to perform either live or batch filtering on a data table. The **filter panel** can accommodate different dropdown and field types, as well as a 3 or 4 column layout. After selections have been made, the filter closes to reveal a **filter display bar**, allowing users to continue to see their filter selections as they work. This component also requires an enlarged overflow menu to accommodate table actions at the mobile level. **Proposed design:** Filter panel: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022173-a8b27580-3dee-11ea-8cde-faa7d6eb34ba.png) Filter display bar: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022191-af40ed00-3dee-11ea-8b04-4a4f296ab9a1.png) Overflow menu (new, large version on left) ### Justification Over a third of IBM Cloud tables are based on a Softlayer table that offer filter panel functionality. If we don't add this functionality to the Carbon data table, users will lose that existing functionality when our platform moves to Carbon X. In general, filtering is a core table functionality, but Carbon lacks a table filtering component. As a result, teams have implemented filters in conflicting ways, causing user confusion and highlighting internal divisions. Last but not least, the filter display bar also allows users to view their filter selections, a key user need that they are not able to accomplish with the current multi-select filter design (the current component simply displays a count). This feature has tested very well with internal and external users. ### Specs: **Desktop** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022241-c41d8080-3dee-11ea-9fe8-a47289bcdb63.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022250-c7187100-3dee-11ea-8d8e-2f61c25030fb.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022260-d13a6f80-3dee-11ea-8dd4-ca537a1e51b2.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022302-f3cc8880-3dee-11ea-9fe1-42a3037a3ac9.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022312-f929d300-3dee-11ea-9993-d1f99ca8070a.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022320-fcbd5a00-3dee-11ea-85aa-7fec61b9b204.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022325-00e97780-3def-11ea-988f-73246eed5db1.png) **Tablet (672px)** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022518-60478780-3def-11ea-9583-013ad427a68f.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73023391-0d6ecf80-3df1-11ea-8f9f-5df8c263592c.png) **Mobile (320px)** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73022619-8ec56280-3def-11ea-85de-774d461f92f6.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73019239-d3013480-3de8-11ea-80dc-819e9dc8d627.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/73023404-1364b080-3df1-11ea-8355-9e4088e13d2b.png) ### Desired UX and success metrics The desired UX is that users can easily discover, apply, and view their filters. Users should be able to see and easily remove one or all of their filter selections. For users that already enjoy this feature on Softlayer tables, the goal is to preserve existing functionality. As a success metric for this feature, we will **track clicks on the filter icon**, as well as use amplitude to track the number of users who use filters on pages where this panel has been implemented. ### "Must have" functionality - The panel can incorporate any single-line Carbon text field or dropdown - The panel can accommodate batch or live filtering (use "apply" as primary button for batch and "done" as primary button for live) - The designer can designate additional filters to go under "view more filters" - Filter selection tags include filter label (eg. location: Dallas 01) - Designer can choose 3 or 4 column layout - **The filter panel and display bar are responsive**, with optimized layouts for tablet and mobile (see above). **This design requires a larger version of the overflow menu in order to fit the larger overflow icon.** (see above) - The filter display bar can be used with batch actions (see above image with blue batch action bar) - The filter panel and bar are keyboard and screen reader accessible - If filter selections cannot all fit in display bar, an overflow count is displayed. The user can click on this count to get a tooltip with listing the "overflow" filter selections. ### Specific timeline issues / requests This work is related to the CloudPAL-sponsored project to contribute back a more robust data table to Carbon by mid-December, as part of Carbon X / CloudPAL adoption. As such, we have a very tight timeline. We would like teams to be able to start consuming these tables at end of January. Our team is working closely with Carbon design and development and trying to anticipate accessibility concerns. ### Available extra resources Holman from ICED development squad in Toronto, possibly CloudPAL developers. Holman is currently working on developing this feature.

items.title: Add interaction option for selecting row in data table
items.body:
### Summary

Currently, rows in the data table component allow selection by clicking the checkbox. However, teams from CPD services such as WKC and WS would like the additional option to select the row by hovering and then clicking on it.

### Justification

Currently, the row enters a hover status when the cursor is on it. Selecting the row requires the user to move the cursor to the left to find the checkbox.

### Desired ux and success metrics
The desired ux is for the users to be able to select the the row by clicking on the empty space of a row. This is without having to find the checkbox. We argue that this is an understandable enhancement since an obvious next step to reading the content of a row is to select it. This is in addition to existing checkbox selection functionality.

### ‚ÄúMust have‚Äù functionality
The functionality described above is simply an enhancement to the hover state by adding interactivity. This would exist alongside checkbox selection functionality. Clicking the empty space of a selected row would unselect it.
 
### Specific timeline issues / requests
Services have already implemented this or are targeting their fall releases for it. We would like for it to be formally recognized by carbon as an option for compliance reasons.

items.title: Provide pagination bar heights to match new data table row heights

labels.name: severity: 3
labels.description: Affects minor functionality, has a workaround

items.body: ### Summary This is a request to add **at least one additional pagination bar height (32px)** to match the available row heights in order to avoid clashing heights. Currently there are 4 possible row heights for data tables: - Compact 24px - Short 32px - Default 48px - Tall 64px With Carbon 11 there will also be a 5th height (Medium 40px) - see https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/issues/8369. However we only have one pagination bar height, meaning that for most row heights, the pagination bar will look out of sync. The difference is most jarring on short and compact row heights. We are asking for development support to add at least a 32px pagination bar height. Ideally we would have matching pagination and toolbar heights for any row height, but adding the 32px pagination bar is an excellent MVP. **As-Is** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/121440640-e9604f80-c94d-11eb-8460-f1fd525bc6d2.png) **Proposed** ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39408106/121440667-f3824e00-c94d-11eb-8693-c9482f39b46a.png) ### Justification We are rolling out the table settings feature more widely, which means that these alternative heights will begin to be more heavily used, making this visual inconsistency more obvious. Adding an additional pagination bar height will allow us to create visual harmony with minimal effort. ### Desired UX and success metrics When user switches to either a short (xs) or compact (sm) row height, the pagination bar would switch to a small height (32px). Same for data table toolbar - see related request [Provide data table toolbar heights to match new row heights #8875](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/issues/8875) ### "Must have" functionality Each of the pagination bar variations would have a 32px version. ### Specific timeline issues / requests Ideally it would be great to roll this out with Carbon 11 as we introduce the new row heights. We would love to roll this update into the data table settings feature being worked on by the Cloud & Cognitive data table workstream. ### Available extra resources We can provide design support and potentially some dev support.
